name: Strike

faqs.q: How do Strike's bitcoin trading fees work?
faqs.a: Strike charges a tiered Strike fee that starts at 0.99% for monthly volume under $250 and steps down to 0.39% once you trade more than $15,000,000. Recurring purchases skip the fee after the first cycle for hourly or daily schedules and after the second run for weekly or monthly schedules.

faqs.q: When are ACH deposits available to withdraw?
faqs.a: ACH deposits post instantly for trading but sit in your pending balance until the transfer settles, which typically takes about five business days plus any extra hold Strike applies based on your history. Once the deposit moves to available balance you can send, spend, or withdraw it.
Yes. Lightning withdrawals from your available bitcoin balance have no Strike fee and settle instantly once your ACH or card deposit has cleared.

You can set a threshold between 1,000,000 and 500,000,000 sats along with one or more payout addresses. When your available balance crosses the threshold Strike queues the full amount, gives you a 12 hour window to cancel, then broadcasts within 24 hours using the fee-free Flexible tier.

Strike is available across the United States except New York, Puerto Rico, and in more than 95 other countries. Availability and payment methods vary, so confirm support in your local App Store or on the Strike website.

WW.text: Live on bitcoin with Bill Pay
Recurring bitcoin buys with fee waivers
ACH deposits must clear before withdrawals

US.text: Bill Pay converts paychecks to bitcoin

recovery_method: Email login with optional 2FA and support assisted resets
description:
Strike is a custodial bitcoin app focused on fast buys and cash like payments. The mobile interface puts bank, card, and direct deposit funding beside instant Lightning withdrawals, so you can move from fiat to bitcoin and back with minimal steps.

Funding options cover fee-free ACH, debit cards with a small processor fee, and same day wires. ACH deposits trade instantly yet stay pending for roughly five business days before you can withdraw, while wires settle in about one business day and debit card purchases clear immediately.

Recurring purchases waive the Strike fee after the first cycle, and optional auto-withdrawals move your balance to self custody once it reaches the threshold you set. Customer prompts inside the app highlight fee tiers, settlement speed, and the 12 hour cancel window Strike gives you before broadcasting auto-withdrawals.

tl_dr.best_for: Buyers who want to DCA and withdraw over Lightning without extra fees.
tl_dr.consider_if: You need bank or debit funding with predictable limits and recurring buys.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You require support for other cryptocurrencies or desktop trading.

steps.title: 1. Create & verify
actions: Install Strike from App Store or Google Play and sign up with your email
Submit your government ID photo and provide your legal name, address, and SSN
Wait for verification to complete—contact support if it takes longer than 24 hours
steps.gotcha: Limits stay conservative until verification clears.

steps.title: 2. Fund (ACH / card / SEPA)
actions: Open Account → Payment methods and link your bank via Plaid or add a debit card
Review your deposit limits for ACH, card, or wire before funding
Deposit cash—ACH trades instantly but stays pending ~5 business days before withdrawal
steps.gotcha: ACH sits in pending ~5 biz days before you can withdraw.

steps.title: 3. Buy & withdraw
steps.why: Own bitcoin and move it to your wallet.
actions: Tap Buy Bitcoin, enter an amount, or set up a recurring purchase to dollar-cost average
Test withdrawal: tap Bitcoin → Send, scan a Lightning invoice or paste a Bitcoin address, and send a small amount (~$5–$10)
Once verified, send the rest—Lightning is instant and free; on-chain offers Priority (~10 min), Standard (~1 hour), or Flexible (~24 hours, free)
steps.gotcha: Flexible on-chain is free but ~24h; Standard ~1h.

micro_faqs.q: How long does Strike verification take?
micro_faqs.a: Strike verification typically completes within a few minutes, though it can take up to 24 hours during high volume. If your account isn't approved within 24 hours, contact Strike support with your sign-up email.

micro_faqs.q: Can I buy bitcoin on Strike without verification?
micro_faqs.a: No. Strike requires full identity verification before you can deposit funds or buy bitcoin. You must submit a government-issued ID and complete KYC to meet regulatory requirements.

micro_faqs.q: What's the fastest way to buy bitcoin on Strike?
micro_faqs.a: Link a debit card for instant deposits and immediate bitcoin purchases. Card funds are available to withdraw right away, while ACH deposits trade instantly but stay pending about five business days before you can send bitcoin off Strike.

fees_scenarios.title: Deposit cash
fees_scenarios.cost_today:
ACH: free
Debit card: ~1.99%
Wire: free (your bank may charge)
fees_scenarios.what_happens: ACH arrives instantly for trading but stays pending about five business days before you can withdraw, debit card funds are available immediately, and wire deposits usually clear within one business day.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Use ACH for fee-free funding, choose wire for large transfers, and monitor Strike Instant eligibility for early access.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Deposit limits start at $1,000 per seven days for ACH and can scale to $100,000, while wire and direct deposit limits are unlimited.

fees_scenarios.title: Buy bitcoin
fees_scenarios.cost_today: 0.99% down to 0.39% as monthly volume increases
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Strike applies the Strike fee tier based on your calendar month buy and sell volume.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Batch purchases to advance tiers and enable recurring buys so ongoing orders skip the fee.

fees_scenarios.title: Withdraw bitcoin
fees_scenarios.cost_today:
Lightning: free
On-chain: Priority or Standard fees vary
Flexible tier: free (~24 hr)
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Lightning withdrawals pay invoices instantly, while on-chain sends let you pick Priority (~10 min), Standard (~1 hour), or Flexible (~24 hours, no fee). Wire cash withdrawals carry a $15 fee with a $50,000 minimum.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Keep a Lightning wallet ready, schedule auto-withdrawals for the Flexible tier, and reserve wires for large cash moves.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Auto-withdrawals queue for 12 hours before broadcast and settle within 24 hours, and ACH funded bitcoin must reach available balance before leaving Strike.

fees_faq.q: Does Strike charge network fees on Lightning withdrawals?
fees_faq.a: Strike covers the Lightning routing cost, so you only pay the invoice amount. On-chain withdrawals still depend on the mining fee tier you pick.

fees_faq.q: When does my Strike fee tier reset?
fees_faq.a: Strike resets monthly trading volume at 00:00 UTC on the first day of the new month, placing you back on the highest fee tier until you trade again.

fees_faq.q: Can I change the speed of an on-chain withdrawal after I send it?
fees_faq.a: You cannot edit a broadcast once Strike submits it, but you can pick Priority, Standard, or Flexible before confirming, and auto-withdrawals give you a 12 hour cancel window.

key_terms.definition: The percentage Strike charges on bitcoin buys and sells. It ranges from 0.99% to 0.39% based on your monthly volume.
ACH or loan proceeds that you can trade but cannot withdraw until Strike marks them available.
A rule that queues your entire bitcoin balance to leave Strike once it reaches a threshold you set.

data_flows: Strike stores the personal information and identity documents you submit during sign up to meet AML and KYC rules.
Bank and card details are shared with regulated payment processors so your deposits and withdrawals can settle.
recovery_drill: Enable two-factor authentication and confirm your email before funding the account.
If you lose access, open the app on a trusted device and follow the in-app recovery prompts or contact support with your ID.
Review the Account > Limits view after recovery to confirm Strike restored your previous limits.
country_caveats: ACH, Bill Pay, and Strike Instant are currently limited to U.S. customers.
Wire deposits and withdrawals require a U.S. bank that supports Fedwire.
Availability and payment options differ by country; confirm support inside the Strike app store listing.

data_flows: Strike retains your legal name, address, phone number, and SSN or national ID to verify the account.
Connected banks and cards route through Plaid and card processors that can see your account and routing numbers.
Strike records Lightning invoices, on-chain addresses, and order history for compliance and customer support.
Support escalations may require you to confirm identity details again before Strike re-enables withdrawals.
privacy.data_flows_do: Turn on two-factor authentication and review recent login sessions in Account > Security.
privacy.data_flows_dont: Reuse the same password you use on other services or share your ID documents outside Strike's secure upload flow.
recovery: Use the email verification link or code Strike sends to reset your password.
If 2FA is enabled, enter your authenticator code or backup code to finish the reset.
Contact support with your legal name and ID if you no longer control the registered email.
privacy.recovery_do: Store authenticator backup codes offline and keep your email secured with its own 2FA.
privacy.recovery_dont: Wait until your account is fully locked before you reach out to Strike support.
withdrawal_policy: Lightning withdrawals are free and process instantly once your balance is available.
On-chain withdrawals offer Priority (~10 min), Standard (~1 hour), and Flexible (~24 hours, no fee) tiers.
ACH funded bitcoin stays locked until the pending window ends, while wire withdrawals require $50,000 minimum and carry a $15 fee.
privacy.withdrawal_policy_do: Plan large cash outs with wires and keep auto-withdrawals in sync with your settlement windows.
privacy.withdrawal_policy_dont: Assume ACH deposits or Strike Instant advances remove the $50,000 wire minimum.
region: Strike operates in the United States (except New York) and 95+ other countries.
Recurring purchases, Bill Pay, and Strike Instant availability depends on your region.
Confirm local limits and payment methods in Account > Limits before funding.

micro_faqs.q: Does Strike support hardware wallet withdrawals?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. You can paste any Bitcoin address from your hardware wallet or trigger an auto-withdrawal to that address.

micro_faqs.q: Can I change my Lightning withdrawal address after triggering auto-withdrawal?
micro_faqs.a: You can edit your address list before the auto-withdrawal broadcasts. Each run gives you a 12 hour cancellation window.

micro_faqs.q: How can I track past withdrawals?
micro_faqs.a: Open Bitcoin > Activity to view completed auto-withdrawals, Lightning sends, and on-chain transactions.

glossary.def: A program that unlocks access to some pending ACH funds before standard settlement when you meet eligibility.
The free on-chain withdrawal option that targets about 24 hour confirmation.
The sat amount that triggers an automatic withdrawal when your balance exceeds it.

compat_heading: What this Strike account can or can't do

compat_tiles.title: Fund with ACH
compat_tiles.benefit: Free ACH Instant trading

compat_tiles.title: Fund with debit card
compat_tiles.benefit: Instant clearance Apple Pay & Google Pay

compat_tiles.title: Withdraw on Lightning
compat_tiles.benefit: Invoices No Strike fee

compat_tiles.title: Withdraw on-chain
compat_tiles.benefit: Priority tier Flexible (no fee)

compat_explainers.why: ACH transfers let you fund Strike without fees while trading immediately.
try: Link your bank in Account > Payment methods
Trade right away while the deposit settles
compat_explainers.gotcha: ACH deposits stay pending about five business days before you can withdraw or auto-withdraw.

compat_explainers.why: Debit cards give you instant settlement for time-sensitive buys.
try: Add your debit card and verify the four digit code
Confirm the processor fee and finish the buy
compat_explainers.gotcha: Card deposits include a processing fee and may have lower weekly limits.

compat_explainers.why: Lightning withdrawals let you exit Strike within seconds without extra cost.
try: Scan your Lightning invoice or paste a Lightning Address
compat_explainers.gotcha: Lightning requires available balance; ACH funded bitcoin must settle before it can leave.

compat_explainers.why: On-chain withdrawals let you choose cost versus confirmation time.
try: Paste a bech32 or legacy address
Pick Priority, Standard, or Flexible then confirm
compat_explainers.gotcha: Flexible tier waits up to 24 hours; Priority and Standard charge a mining fee.

features.title: Dollar-cost averaging (DCA)
features.description: Set up recurring purchases daily, weekly, or monthly. After the first cycle, Strike waives fees on all future orders.

features.title: Auto-withdraw
features.description: Set a threshold (1M-500M sats) and Strike automatically sends your balance to your wallet once reached. 12-hour cancel window before broadcast.

features.title: Lightning withdrawals
features.description: Send bitcoin instantly over Lightning to any compatible wallet. Strike covers routing fees.

features.title: On-chain withdrawals
features.description: Choose Priority (~10 min), Standard (~1 hour), or Flexible (~24 hours, free) based on urgency.

tiles.title: 1. Pick a cold storage wallet
tiles.why: Cold storage keeps your bitcoin offline and secure from hackers.
actions: Choose a cold storage wallet
Buy and initialize your hardware wallet or install cold storage software
Generate a new seed phrase and write it down on paper
Store your seed phrase in a fireproof safe or safety deposit box
tiles.gotcha: Hardware wallets cost money but provide the highest security. Never store your seed phrase digitally.

tiles.title: 2. Create a fresh receive address
tiles.why: Fresh addresses prevent tracking and enhance privacy.
actions: Connect your hardware wallet to a companion app or computer
Generate a new receive address in your wallet software
Copy the Bitcoin address (starts with bc1, 1, or 3)
Use this address only once for your Strike withdrawal
tiles.gotcha: Never reuse Bitcoin addresses. Hardware wallets generate fresh addresses automatically for privacy.

tiles.title: 3. Send a small test amount
tiles.why: Test the full withdrawal process before moving larger amounts.
actions: In Strike: tap Bitcoin > Send > Bitcoin wallet
Paste your hardware wallet's fresh Bitcoin address
Send $5–$10 worth of bitcoin using Standard tier (~1 hour)
Wait for confirmation then verify in your hardware wallet
tiles.gotcha: Use Standard tier for reliable but cost-effective confirmation. Priority is faster but more expensive.

tiles.title: 4. Withdraw the remaining balance
tiles.why: Complete your transition to self-custody with full control.
actions: For smaller amounts: use Standard tier (~1 hour, ~$5–$10 fee)
For larger amounts: use Flexible tier (~24 hours, free)
Generate a fresh address for your remaining withdrawal
Send the rest of your balance and store your hardware wallet securely
tiles.gotcha: Flexible tier is free but can take up to 24 hours. Standard tier balances speed and cost effectively.

micro_faqs.q: Why should I use cold storage?
micro_faqs.a: Cold storage keeps your bitcoin offline, protecting it from hackers and online threats. Hardware wallets provide military-grade security for long-term holding.

micro_faqs.q: How do I verify my withdrawal arrived?
micro_faqs.a: Check your hardware wallet's transaction history or use a block explorer like mempool.space. On-chain transactions confirm within 10 minutes to 24 hours depending on your fee tier.

micro_faqs.q: What's the safest way to store my seed phrase?
micro_faqs.a: Memorize your 12-24 word seed phrase or write it on paper or metal. Store copies in separate secure locations like a fireproof safe and safety deposit box. Never store it digitally.
